IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO PROMOTE THE OPTIMAL HEALTH AND WELL BEING OF CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH SPECIAL HEALTH CARE NEEDS BY PROVIDING FAMILY CENTERED, COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTION, INTERVENTION AND TREATMENT SERVICES WITHIN A MEDICAL HOME ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROMOTE THE OPTIMAL HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH SPECIAL HEALTH CARE NEEDS BY PROVIDING FAMILY CENTERED, COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTION, INTERVENTION AND TREATMENT SERVICES WITHIN A MEDICAL HOME ENVIRONMENT. OUR VISION IS TO PROVIDE A CENTER OF EXCELLENCE THAT INSPIRES AND SUPPORTS THE OPTIMAL POTENTIAL OF OUR COMMUNITY'S CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL HEALTH CARE NEEDS THROUGH CARE, EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND COLLABORATION.
IRS990.Desc: COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTION, INTERVENTION AND TREATMENT SERVICES TO CHILDREN - ESTABLISHED IN 1983 AS THE FOLLOW-UP PROGRAM OF THE STATE'S REGIONAL PERINATAL INTENSIVE CARE CENTER SYSTEM, THE CHILDREN'S DIAGNOSTIC & TREATMENT CENTER (CDTC) HAS GROWN TO BE ONE OF THE LARGEST CHILDRENS AGENCIES IN SOUTH FLORIDA, SERVING OVER 10,000 CHILDREN AND YOUTH ANNUALLY. THE CENTER'S FOCUS HAS ALWAYS BEEN TO PROVIDE MEDICAL CARE, CASE MANAGEMENT, SOCIAL SERVICES AND OTHER TYPES OF INTERVENTION TO CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS WITH CHRONIC ILLNESSES AND DEVELOPMENT DISABILITIES AND TO PROVIDE SUPPORT AND EDUCATION TO THEIR FAMILIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE DRAFT 990 IS SENT VIA EMAIL WITH PDF FILE ATTACHMENT FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: QUERY MADE IN THE FORM OF A SURVEY AT MONTHLY AND QUARTERLY MEETINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MANAGEMENT TEAM AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER DETERMINE SALARIES FOR ALL PERSONNEL IN COOPERATION WITH THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT WHICH IS CHARGED WITH DETERMINING COMPARABLE RATES OF PAY IN THE IMMEDIATE AND SURROUNDING AREAS/MARKETS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PROVIDES FINAL APPROVAL IN CONNECTION WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S ANNUAL BUDGET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST BY THE INQUIRING PARTY.

OUTSIDE SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 160,554. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 160,554. CONSULTANT FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 3,548,290. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 3,548,290.

DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, THE PARENT IMPLEMENTED GASB STATEMENT NO. 75., ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING FOR POSTEMPLOYMENT BENEFITS OTHER THAN PENSIONS. AS A RESULT, THE ORGANIZATION'S PROPORTIONATE LIABILITY ASSOCIATED WITH THE RESULTING OTHER POSTEMPLOYMENT BENEFIT LIABILITIES WAS APPROXIMATELY $4,312,000. THIS AMOUNT HAS BEEN INCLUDED AS A RESTATEMENT OF PRIOR PERIOD NET ASSETS.
